A score of 1 represents a perfect submission with no errors on the test set while 0 represents a performance no better than chance. if pattern 3 is less than 5 the Gleason score 4 3 will instead be 4 4. We see karaolinska provides more of the training examples with ISUP grade 0 or 1 while radboud provides more of the training examples with ISUP grade 3 4 or 5. To simplify slightly in the case of multiple different Gleason patterns being present the score is composed of the most frequently occurring pattern and the second most frequent pattern in the biopsy as judged by the pathologist. 1 the patterns present in a single biopsy are used to form a Gleason score e. We see here that within the test data we are provided with image id and data_provider. Radboud labels benign examples as negative label while karolinska uses 0 0. We also see that benign slides have two different lables 0 0 or negative presumably this is due to variation in labelling by data provider. We have the same two unique data providers. We see that over 25 of our data is benign ISUP grade 0 while another 25 is ISUP grade 1 the other 4 ISUP grades are present in our data at a rate in the range 11. 10616 image ids images can be loaded from this unique id and the corresponding data provider karoliska or radboud ISUP grade and Gleason Score which directly leads to the ISUP grade as per Figure 1. The system suffers from significant inter observer variability while in some countries there is a lack of qaulified pathologists. The training set for this challenge is the most extensive multi center dataset on Gleason grading available. Submissions will be scored based on their performance in predicting an ISUP grade for a hidden test set graded by expert pathologists.
